conclusion: Consider the thermodynamic process depicted in the PV diagram.
The path from D to A is a horizontal line on the PV diagram, indicating an isobaric process.
For an isobaric process, the work done by the gas is given by W = P ΔV.
The pressure at state D (and also at state A since it's isobaric) is P1.
The volume changes from V2 at state D to V1 at state A.
The change in volume, ΔV, is V1 - V2.
The work done by the gas during the transition from D to A is W = P1 (V1 - V2).
Since the volume decreases, the work done by the gas is negative.
The work done by the gas on the surroundings when transitioning from state D to state A is W = -P1 (V1 - V2).
